etymologies: from Old French graal, from medieval Latin gradalis ‘dish’

definitions: (in medieval legend) the cup or platter used by Jesus at the Last Supper, and in which Joseph of Arimathea received Christ's blood at the Cross. Quests for it undertaken by medieval knights are described in versions of the Arthurian legends written from the early 13th century onward.
shortDefinitions: cup or platter used by Christ at Last Supper

definitions: a thing that is eagerly pursued or sought after

examples.text: a cure for the common cold is the medical holy grail
youth culture became the grail of broadcasting

shortDefinitions: thing that is eagerly pursued or sought after

definitions: a thing that is being earnestly pursued or sought after

examples.text: profit has become the holy grail

shortDefinitions: thing that is being earnestly pursued or sought after
